blocks.name: addDataToDataset
blocks.description: This operation creates a new dataset with the specified rows, or if the dataset already exists, adds rows to the dataset. If the specified data contains records with timestamps that already exist in the dataset, those records will be overwritten.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: dataSetName
args.info: Name of the dataset to which to add data.

blocks.name: deleteDataFromDataset
blocks.description: If a date range is specified, then only data in that date range is removed from the dataset. Otherwise, all data is removed from the dataset.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: dataSetName
args.info: Name of the dataset from which to remove data

args.name: startDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Limits data removed to those on or after the specified date.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Limits data removed to those on or before the specified date.

args.name: cascade
args.info: Options for cascading the delete. When cascade=forecast, also deletes forecasts for the dataset. When cascade=sessions, also deletes sessions associated with the dataset. If start and/or end date are supplied, sessions requested in that date range are deleted.

blocks.name: getAllDatasets
blocks.description: Gets the list of datasets that have been uploaded.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: partialName
args.info: Limits results to only those datasets with names containing the specified value.

args.name: page
args.info: Format - int32. Zero-based page number of datasets to retrieve.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Format - int32. Count of datasets to retrieve in each page (max 1000).

blocks.name: getSingleDataset
blocks.description: Gets the data for a particular dataset.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: dataSetName
args.info: Name of the dataset for which to retrieve data.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Limits data removed to those on or after the specified date.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Limits data removed to those on or before the specified date.

args.name: page
args.info: Format - int32. Zero-based page number of datasets to retrieve.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Format - int32. Count of datasets to retrieve in each page (max 1000).

args.name: include
args.info: Limits results to the specified columns.

blocks.name: importFromS3
blocks.description: Import data into Axon from a file on S3.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: dataSetName
args.info: Name of the dataset.

args.name: bucket
args.info: S3 bucket.

args.name: path
args.info: S3 path.

args.name: region
args.info: Bucket region.

blocks.name: getAllImports
blocks.description: Gets the list of imports that have been created for the company associated with your account.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: dataSetName
args.info: Limits imports to those for a particular dataset.

args.name: requestedAfterDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Limits imports to those requested on or after the specified date.

args.name: requestedBeforeDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Limits imports to those requested on or before the specified date.

args.name: page
args.info: Format - int32. Zero-based page number of datasets to retrieve.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Format - int32. Count of datasets to retrieve in each page (max 1000).

blocks.name: getSingleImport
blocks.description: Retrieve information about request to import data into Axon.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: importId
args.info: Format - uuid. The Id of the Import.

blocks.name: createForecastSession
blocks.description: Forecast sessions are used to predict future values for a dataset. To create a forecast session, specify the dataset to forecast, as well as the start and end dates of the forecast period. The Nexosis API will execute a series of machine learning algorithms to approximate future values for the dataset. The forecast start date should be on the same day as (or before) the last date in the dataset. If there is a gap between your forecast start date and the date of the last record in your data set, the Nexosis API will behave as if there is no gap.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: dataSetName
args.info: Name of the dataset to forecast.

args.name: targetColumn
args.info: Column in the specified dataset to forecast.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). First date to forecast.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Last date to forecast.

args.name: resultInterval
args.info: The interval at which predictions should be generated. Possible values are Hour, Day, Week, Month, and Year. Defaults to Day.

args.name: callbackUrl
args.info: The Webhook url that will receive updates when the Session status changes. If you provide a callback url, your response will contain a header named Nexosis - Webhook - Token.You will receive this same header in the request message to your Webhook,which you can use to validate that the message came from Nexosis.

args.name: isEstimate
args.info: If specified, the session will not be processed. The returned Nexosis-Request-Cost header will be populated with the estimated cost that the request would have incurred.

blocks.name: createImpactSession
blocks.description: Impact sessions are used to determine the impact of a particular event on a dataset. For example, a sale at a restaurant may impact daily sales or customer counts.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: dataSetName
args.info: Name of the dataset for which to determine impact.

args.name: targetColumn
args.info: Column in the specified dataset for which to determine impact.

args.name: eventName
args.info: Name of the event for which to determine impact.

args.name: resultInterval
args.info: The interval at which predictions should be generated. Possible values are Hour, Day, Week, Month, and Year. Defaults to Day.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). First date of the event.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Last date of the event.

args.name: callbackUrl
args.info: The Webhook url that will receive updates when the Session status changes

args.name: isEstimate
args.info: If specified, the session will not be processed. The returned Nexosis-Request-Cost header will be populated with the estimated cost that the request would have incurred.

blocks.name: deleteSession
blocks.description: Removes a single session from your account.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: sessionId
args.info: Format - uuid. The Id of the session to delete.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: type
args.info: The type of session to be deleted (Forecast or Impact).

args.name: dataSetName
args.info: Limits sessions to those for a particular dataset.

args.name: eventName
args.info: Limits impact sessions to those for a particular event.

args.name: requestedAfterDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Limits sessions to those requested on or after the specified date.

args.name: requestedBeforeDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Limits sessions to those requested on or before the specified date.

blocks.name: getAllSession
blocks.description: Gets the list of sessions that have been created for the company associated with your account.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: dataSetName
args.info: Limits sessions to those for a particular dataset.

args.name: eventName
args.info: Limits impact sessions to those for a particular event.

args.name: requestedAfterDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Limits sessions to those requested on or after the specified date.

args.name: requestedBeforeDate
args.info: Format - date-time (as date-time in ISO8601). Limits sessions to those requested on or before the specified date.

args.name: page
args.info: Format - int32. Zero-based page number of sessions to retrieve.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Format - int32. Count of sessions to retrieve in each page (max 1000).

blocks.name: getSessionResult
blocks.description: Gets the forecast or impact results of a particular session

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: sessionId
args.info: Format - uuid. Session identifier for which to retrieve results.

blocks.name: getSingleSession
blocks.description: Gets the forecast or impact results of a particular session

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: sessionId
args.info: Format - uuid. Session identifier of the session to retrieve.

blocks.name: getSessionStatus
blocks.description: The response to this endpoint adds a nexosis-session-status HTTP response header indicating the completion status of the session.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API. Found in your Profile.

args.name: sessionId
args.info: Format - uuid. Session identifier of the session to retrieve.
